Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a level top, defined by two mouldings, extending to a wick-hole in its blunt tip; there is no filling-hole. The underbody is decorated with a row of large impressed points, below which is a volute pattern. At its rear rises a stem in the form of a column, surmounted by a duck's head. Standing on top of the lamp and leaning against the column is a figure of an Amazon (or possibly Athena) with an oval shield, wearing a short tunic and a helmet or Phrygian cap. The lamp has a small raised oval base.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1992.bis)
